title: “certificate of exemption” means a certificate referred to in Regulation 7(1) or,
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Control of Dogs (XL Bully)
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Control of Dogs (XL Bully) 

Regulations 2024. 

Commencement
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited control dog (xl bully) regulation 2024 commencement

title: “certificate of exemption” means a certificate referred to in Regulation 7(1) or,
heading: 2. These Regulations shall come into operation on 1 October 2024.
text_raw:
2. These Regulations shall come into operation on 1 October 2024. 

Definitions
text_norm: 2 regulation shall come operation 1 october 2024 definition

title: “certificate of exemption” means a certificate referred to in Regulation 7(1) or,
heading: In these Regulations –
text_raw:
3. 

In these Regulations – 

“certificate of exemption” means a certificate referred to in Regulation 7(1) or, 
where Regulation 6 applies, an equivalent certificate; 

“equivalent certificate”, in relation to an XL Bully, means a document issued in 
another jurisdiction which states that – 

(a) 

the XL Bully has been microchipped in accordance with the 
Microchipping of Dogs Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 63 of 2015), 
and 

(b) 

the XL Bully has been neutered; 

“relevant body” means – 

(a) 

(b) 

the Irish Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals, or 

a registered charitable organisation, within the meaning of the 
Charities Act 2009, whose charitable purpose, within the meaning 
of that Act, is the prevention or relief of suffering of animals; 

“relevant owner”, in relation to a relevant XL Bully, means the person who is 
the owner, referred to in Regulation 5(2), of that XL Bully; 

“relevant XL Bully” means an XL Bully referred to in Regulation 5(2); 

“XL Bully” shall be construed in accordance with Regulation 4. 

XL Bully for purposes of Regulations

title: “certificate of exemption” means a certificate referred to in Regulation 7(1) or,
heading: 4. A reference in these Regulations to an XL Bully means a dog which
text_raw:
4. A reference in these Regulations to an XL Bully means a dog which 
substantially meets the physical conformation standard specified in Schedule 1 
and, in the case of an XL Bully which has not attained the age of 18 months, has 
the potential to do so on or after attaining that age. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 27th September, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [491] 3 

Prohibition on ownership, etc., of XL Bully and exceptions thereto
text_norm: 4 reference regulation xl bully mean dog substantially meet physical conformation standard specified schedule 1 case xl bully attained age 18 month potential attaining age notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 27th september 2024 491 3 prohibition ownership etc xl bully exception thereto

title: “certificate of exemption” means a certificate referred to in Regulation 7(1) or,
heading: 5. (1) Subject to paragraphs (2), (4) and (5) and Regulations 6 and 8(1)(c),
text_raw:
5. (1) Subject to paragraphs (2), (4) and (5) and Regulations 6 and 8(1)(c), 
with effect from 1 October 2024, a person shall not own, keep, purchase, dispose 
of (whether by sale or otherwise), abandon, allow to stray, breed or import an 
XL Bully. 

(2) Subject to paragraph (3), paragraph (1) shall not apply in the case of – 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

an XL Bully owned by a person (including a relevant body) 
immediately before 1 October 2024, 

an XL Bully owned by a person (including a relevant body) where 
the XL Bully was born on or after 1 October 2024 and before 10 
December 2024, or 

an XL Bully owned by a person on or after 1 October 2024 and 
before 1 February 2025 where the person became such owner by 
virtue of the disposal of that XL Bully effected by a relevant body. 

(3) Subject to paragraphs (4) and (5) and Regulation 6(2), paragraph (1) 
shall, with effect from 1 February 2025, apply to a relevant XL Bully and its 
relevant owner except in the case of such XL Bully the subject of a certificate of 
exemption – 

(a) 

issued to the owner before that date, and 

(b) which is valid. 

(4) 

(a) Subject to subparagraph (b), paragraphs (1) and (3), in so far as 
they relate to the ownership of a relevant XL Bully and its 
relevant owner, shall not apply to such XL Bully and owner where 
the XL Bully is the subject of an application under Regulation 7 
which has been made by the owner before 1 February 2025 but 
not determined before that date. 

(b) Upon the date of the day immediately following the day on which 
an application referred to in subparagraph (a) is determined - 

(i) 

paragraph (1) shall apply to the ownership of the relevant 
XL Bully and its relevant owner concerned as if that date 
were substituted for the date “1 October 2024” referred to 
in that paragraph, 

(ii) paragraph (3) shall apply to the ownership of the relevant 
XL Bully and its relevant owner concerned as if that date 
were substituted for the date “1 Februrary 2025” referred to 
in that paragraph, and 

(iii) Regulation 9 shall apply to the ownership of the relevant 
XL Bully and its relevant owner concerned as if that date 
were substituted for the date “1 February 2025” referred to 
in that Regulation. 

(5) Where paragraph (2) or (3) effects a disapplication of paragraph (1) to a 
relevant XL Bully and its relevant owner, such disapplication only applies to – 

(a) 

the ownership and keeping of the XL Bully by the relevant owner, 

 
 4 [491] 

(b) 

the disposal, referred to in Regulation 8(1)(c), of the XL Bully, 
and 

(c) where the relevant owner is a relevant body, any disposal by such 

body of the XL Bully effected before 1 February 2025. 

Special cases for certain XL Bullys outside State

title: “certificate of exemption” means a certificate referred to in Regulation 7(1) or,
heading: 6. (1) Paragraph (2) shall apply to an XL Bully owned by a person –
text_raw:
6. (1) Paragraph (2) shall apply to an XL Bully owned by a person – 

(a) 

before 1 October 2024, 

(b) who was once ordinarily resident in the State but is not ordinarily 
resident in the State during the period from 1 October 2024 to 1 
February 2025, 

(c) who returns to the State on or after 1 February 2025 with the XL 
Bully and with the intention of once again becoming ordinarily 
resident in the State, and 

(d) who can provide documentation showing that – 

(i) 

he or she owned the XL Bully before 1 October 2024, or 

(ii) 

the XL Bully is the subject of – 

(I) 

a certificate of exemption, or 

(II) an equivalent certificate. 

(2) These Regulations shall apply to an XL Bully and the person who owns 
it referred to in paragraph (1) as if the reference in Regulation 5(3) to “1 February 
2025” were a reference to that date which is exactly 3 months after the date on 
which the person returns to the State as specified in paragraph (1)(c), and with 
any other necessary modifications. 

(3) The other provisions of these Regulations (except Regulation 8(1) (e), 

(f), (g) and (h)) shall not apply to a person who owns an XL Bully where – 

(a) 

(b) 

he or she is not ordinarily resident in the State and is not a person 
referred to in paragraph (1), 

the person brings the XL Bully into the State for not more than 30 
days in total in any year, and 

(c) 

the XL Bully is the subject of – 

(i) 

a certificate of exemption, or 

(ii) 

an equivalent certificate. 

Certificate of exemption

title: “certificate of exemption” means a certificate referred to in Regulation 7(1) or,
heading: 7. (1) The relevant owner of a relevant XL Bully may make an application,
text_raw:
7. (1) The relevant owner of a relevant XL Bully may make an application, 

in the form set out in Schedule 2 – 

(a) 

for the issue of a certificate, in the form set out in Schedule 3, 
permitting the owner to continue to own the XL Bully on and after 
1 February 2025 for so long as the certificate is valid, and 

 
 
 
 [491] 5 

(b) 

to the local authority for the functional area in which the XL Bully 
– 

(i) 

is kept, or 

(ii) 

is intended to be kept after the issue (if any) of such 
certificate. 

(2) The local authority concerned shall determine an application under 

paragraph (1) – 

(a) 

by issuing to the applicant a certificate of exemption where – 

(i) 

(ii) 

it is satisfied that the application complies with all the 
requirements of these Regulations in so far as they relate to 
the application, and 

the information contained in, or annexed to, the application 
satisfies the local authority that the XL Bully the subject of 
the application – 

(I) 

either – 

(A) 

(B) 

is the subject of a dog licence, issued under 
section 3(1) of the Act, which is valid, or 

is not required to be the subject of such dog 
licence by virtue of section 5 of the Act, 

(II) 

is microchipped 
the 
Microchipping of Dogs Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 63 
of 2015), and 

accordance with 

in 

(III) is the subject of a confirmation, in the form set out in 

Schedule 4, stating that the XL Bully – 

(A) has been neutered, or 

(B) 

is exempt from neutering, or 

(b) 

in any other case, by refusing the application. 

Requirements applicable to owner of XL Bully after issue of certificate of 
exemption

title: “certificate of exemption” means a certificate referred to in Regulation 7(1) or,
heading: 8. (1) The owner of an XL Bully the subject of a certificate of exemption –
text_raw:
8. (1) The owner of an XL Bully the subject of a certificate of exemption – 

(a) 

shall, subject to paragraph (2), keep the XL Bully at the same 
address at which the owner resides, 

(b) 

shall, subject to paragraph (3) – 

(i) make an application, in the form set out in Schedule 2, for 

a new certificate of exemption – 

(I) 

if the owner changes his or her place of residence, 

(II) 

to the local authority which issued such certificate or, 
if applicable, the local authority for the functional 
area in which the new place of residence is situated, 
and 

 
 
 6 [491] 

(III) not more than 30 days after the day on which he or 
she changed his or her place of residence, and 

(ii) 

if the application referred to in clause (i) is made to the local 
authority second-mentioned in clause (i)(II), send a copy of 
that application, marked “For Information Only”, to the 
local authority first-mentioned in clause (i)(II), 

(c) 

shall, if he or she has become such owner due to the death of the 
person named in the certificate of exemption as the owner of the 
XL Bully or due to the incapacity, for whatever reason, of such 
person to continue to own the XL Bully – 

(i) make an application, in the form set out in Schedule 2 and 
not later than 3 months after he or she became such owner, 
for a new certificate of exemption to the local authority 
which issued such certificate or, if applicable, the local 
authority for the functional area in which the place of 
residence of the owner is situated, and 

(ii) 

if the application referred to in clause (i) is made to the local 
authority second-mentioned in that clause, send a copy of 
that application, marked “For Information Only”, to the 
local authority first-mentioned in that clause, 

(d) 

shall, if the XL Bully dies or is exported, give notice in writing of 
that fact, to the local authority which issued such certificate, not 
later than 30 days after such death or export, as the case may be, 

(e) 

shall not permit the XL Bully to be in a public place unless the 
XL Bully is – 

(i) 

being led by means of a sufficiently strong chain or leash 
not exceeding two metres in length by a person over the age 
of 16 years who is capable of controlling the XL Bully, and 

(ii) 

securely muzzled in a manner which prevents the XL Bully 
from biting, 

(f) 

shall ensure that – 

(i) 

(ii) 

the premises at which the XL Bully is kept are appropriate 
for the welfare of the XL Bully, and 

such premises are secured in a manner which prevents the 
XL Bully from escaping therefrom, 

(g) 

(h) 

shall, if the XL Bully is microchipped in accordance with the 
Microchipping of Dogs Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 63 of 2015), 
permit a dog warden to read the XL Bully’s microchip upon any 
reasonable request to do so made by the dog warden, 

shall, if requested by a dog warden to do so, produce such 
certificate, within ten days of the date of the request, for 
examination by the dog warden, and 

(i) 

shall, if the XL Bully is the subject of a confirmation referred to 
in Regulation 7(2)(a)(ii)(III)(B) and the only medical reasons 

 
 [491] 7 

specified in the confirmation relate to the fact that the XL Bully 
has not attained the age of 18 months at the time such 
confirmation was issued, ensure that, as soon as is practicable 
after the XL Bully has attained that age – 

(i) 

the XL Bully is neutered, and 

(ii) 

the local authority which issued the certificate of exemption 
is given a copy of a confirmation, in the form set out in 
Schedule 4, stating that the XL Bully has been neutered. 

(2) Subparagraph (a) of paragraph (1) shall not apply in any case where the 
XL Bully is kept, for not more than 30 days in total in any year, at an address 
other than the address at which the owner of the XL Bully resides. 

(3) Subparagraph (b) of paragraph (1) shall not apply in any case where the 
owner of the XL Bully returns to his or her place of residence specified in the 
certificate of exemption issued in respect of the XL Bully within 30 days of 
changing his or her place of residence. 

(4) Subject to paragraphs (2) and (3), a certificate of exemption issued in 
respect of an XL Bully ceases to be valid if the owner of the XL Bully fails to 
comply with subparagraph (a), (b) or (c) of paragraph (1). 

Destruction in humane manner of XL Bully not subject of certificate of exemption

heading: 9. Subject to Regulation 5(4)(b)(iii), on and after 1 February 2025, a dog
text_raw:
9. Subject to Regulation 5(4)(b)(iii), on and after 1 February 2025, a dog 

warden may - 

(a) 

seize and detain an XL Bully which is not the subject of a 
certificate of exemption, and 

(b) destroy, or cause to be destroyed, in a humane manner, such XL 

Bully.

title: “certificate of exemption” means a certificate referred to in Regulation 7(1) or,
heading: PHYSICAL CONFORMATION STANDARD FOR XL BULLY
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 1 

PHYSICAL CONFORMATION STANDARD FOR XL BULLY 

Introduction
text_norm: schedule 1 physical conformation standard xl bully introduction

title: “certificate of exemption” means a certificate referred to in Regulation 7(1) or,
heading: 1. The XL Bully type is a variant of the wider American Bully breed type.
text_raw:
1. The XL Bully type is a variant of the wider American Bully breed type. 
The XL Bully is typically larger (both in terms of height and body shape) and 
more muscular than other American Bully breed types such as the “Micro”, 
“Pocket”, “Standard” or “Classic”. 

Description of characteristics
text_norm: 1 xl bully type variant wider american bully breed type xl bully typically larger (both term height body shape) muscular american bully breed type micro pocket standard classic  description characteristic

title: “certificate of exemption” means a certificate referred to in Regulation 7(1) or,
heading: 2. The following table sets out a description of the characteristics of an XL
text_raw:
2. The following table sets out a description of the characteristics of an XL 

Bully: 

Characteristics 

Description 

Table 

General impression Large dog with a muscular body and blocky head, suggesting great 

strength and power for its size. Powerfully built individual. 

Height 

Adult male from 51 cm (20 inches) at the withers. 

Adult female from 48 cm (19 inches) at the withers. 

Head 

Heavy, large and broad. 

The length from the tip of the nose to a well-defined stop (indentation 
between muzzle and the head) is equal to around one-third of the length 
from the tip of the nose to the back of the head. 

Muzzle blocky or slightly squared to fall away below the eyes. 

Topline of muzzle straight. 

Prominent cheek muscles with strong, well-defined jaws and lips semiclose. 

Often having prominent wrinkles on face. 

Nose is large with well opened nostrils. 

Level or scissor bite. 

Heavy, muscular, slightly arched, tapering from the shoulders to the 
base of the skull. 

Medium in length. 

Teeth 

Neck 

Forequarters 

Shoulder blades are long, well-muscled and well laid back. 

Upper arm length is about equal to the length of the shoulder blades 
and joined at a 35-45 degree angle to the ground. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [491] 9 

Characteristics 

Description 

Front legs straight, strong and very muscular with dog standing high on 
the pasterns (area between feet and ankles). 

Elbows set close to the body. 

Distance from the withers to elbows about the same as the distance 
from the elbow to the bottom of the feet. 

Body 

Heavily-muscled. 

Large, blocky body giving impressionof great power for size. 

Broad, deep chest with well sprung ribs. 

Chest may be wider than deep. 

Topline level and straight. 

Loin short and firm. 

Generally appears square shaped from point of the shoulder to the point 
of the buttocks compared with the withers (tallest point on the dog’s 
body excluding head and shoulders) to the ground. 

Hindquarters 

Strong, muscular and broad. 

Thighs well developed with thick musculature. 

From behind, both pasterns are typically straight and parallel to each 
other. 

Muscular development, angulation and width in balance with 
forequarters. 

Rounded, medium in size and in proportion to body. 

Compact and well arched. 

Medium length and low set. 

Tapers to a point to end at about the level of the hocks. 

Generally assumes a straight or pump handle shape when dog releaxed. 

Feet 

Tail 

Coat 

Glossy, smooth, close, single. 

Glossary
text_norm: 2 following table set description characteristic xl bully characteristic description table general impression large dog muscular body blocky head suggesting great strength power size powerfully built individual height adult male 51 cm (20 inches) withers adult female 48 cm (19 inches) withers head heavy large broad length tip nose well-defined stop (indentation muzzle head) equal around one-third length tip nose back head muzzle blocky slightly squared fall away eye topline muzzle straight prominent cheek muscle strong well-defined jaw lip semiclose often prominent wrinkle face nose large well opened nostril level scissor bite heavy muscular slightly arched tapering shoulder base skull medium length teeth neck forequarter shoulder blade long well-muscled well laid back upper arm length equal length shoulder blade joined 35-45 degree angle ground 491 9 characteristic description front leg straight strong muscular dog standing high pastern (area foot ankles) elbow set close body distance withers elbow distance elbow bottom foot body heavily-muscled large blocky body giving impressionof great power size broad deep chest well sprung rib chest may wider deep topline level straight loin short firm generally appears square shaped point shoulder point buttock compared withers (tallest point dog body excluding head shoulders) ground hindquarter strong muscular broad thigh well developed thick musculature behind pastern typically straight parallel other muscular development angulation width balance forequarter rounded medium size proportion body compact well arched medium length low set taper point end level hock generally assumes straight pump handle shape dog releaxed foot tail coat glossy smooth close single glossary

title: “certificate of exemption” means a certificate referred to in Regulation 7(1) or,
heading: 3. The following table sets out a glossary of the terms used in this Schedule:
text_raw:
3. The following table sets out a glossary of the terms used in this Schedule: 

Term 

Bite 

Coat 

Table 

Description 

The relative position of the upper and lower 
teeth when the mouth is closed. 

The hairy outer covering of the skin. 

 
 
 
 
 10 [491] 

Term 

Croup 

Forequarters 

Hindquarters 

Loin 

Musculature 

Muzzle 

Pasterns 

Scissor bite 

Description 

Part of the back from the front of the pelvis to 
root of the tail. 

The front part of dog excluding head and 
neck. 

Rear part of dog from behind the loin. 

The region between the last rib and the 
beginning of the pelvis. 

The muscles on an animal’s body. 

The length from the tip of the nose to the stop. 

The pastern is the lower part of the foreleg, 
just above the foot and below the wrist. 
Similarly, in the hind leg, the pastern is the 
portion located above the foot and below the 
heel (alos known as the hock). Every canine 
possesses a pair of front and rear pasterns. 

The upper front teeth closely overlapping the 
lower teeth and set square to the jaws. 

Spring of rib 

Degree of curvature of rib cage. 

Tail set 

Tapering 

Top line 

Withers 

The position of the tail on the croup. 

Becomes progressively smaller towards one 
end. 

An outline after the withers to the tail set. 
Viewed from the side of the dog or from 
above. 

The highest point of body immediately 
behind the neck where height is measured. 

 
 
 
 [491] 11 

Regulations 7 and 8

title: “certificate of exemption” means a certificate referred to in Regulation 7(1) or,

title: “certificate of exemption” means a certificate referred to in Regulation 7(1) or,
heading: I understand that failure to comply with any of the above conditions may
text_raw:
2. 

I understand that failure to comply with any of the above conditions may 
result in the seizure of the dog by an Authorised Officer and that the dog may be 
destroyed in a humane manner by a registered Veterinary Surgeon.

title: “certificate of exemption” means a certificate referred to in Regulation 7(1) or,
heading: I understand that it is a criminal offence to keep a dog of this type after
text_raw:
3. 

I understand that it is a criminal offence to keep a dog of this type after 
31 January 2025, without having made a valid application for a Certificate of 
Exemption. This may result in the seizure of the dog by an Authorised Officer 
with subsequent arrangements for euthanasia by a Veterinary Surgeon.
text_norm: 3 understand criminal offence keep dog type 31 january 2025 without made valid application certificate exemption may result seizure dog authorised officer subsequent arrangement euthanasia veterinary surgeon

text_raw:
4. 

I undertake to ensure that the dog is accommodated in a premises that is 
secure, appropriate to its welfare and in such a manner as to prevent the dog's 
escape.

text_raw:
5. 

I understand that it is my responsibility as the dog owner to ensure that I 
am compliant with all other relevant legislation relating to the ownership of the 
dog. 

I understand that it is illegal to do any of the following in relation to the

title: “certificate of exemption” means a certificate referred to in Regulation 7(1) or,
text_raw:
6. 
dog: 

i. 

ii. 

iii. 

breed from the dog 

dispose, sell or exchange the dog 

advertise or expose the dog for sale, give the dog as a gift, or 
advertise the dog as a gift 

iv. 

abandon the dog or allow the dog to stray 

v. 

Fail to keep the dog muzzled in a public place 

vi. Fail to keep the dog on a lead in a public place 

vii. Fail to keep the dog in appropriate and secure accommodation 

I consent that the Local Authority processing this application for Certificate of 
Exemption will collect and process a certain amount of my personal data in order 
to process this application. This data will be handled, stored and processed in 
accordance with that Local Authority’s Data Protection and Privacy Policy. 

I acknowledge that providing false details or failing to comply with the 
Certificate of Exemption requirements will invalidate the Certificate. In such 
cases, I may face prosecution, and the dog mentioned in this application may be 
seized and subsequently destroyed in a humane manner.

heading: CONFIRMATION THAT XL BULLY HAS BEEN
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 4 

CONFIRMATION THAT XL BULLY HAS BEEN 

NEUTERED OR IS EXEMPT FROM BEING NEUTERED 

Veterinary Confirmation of Neutering Status 

Confirmation that an XL Bully Type dog has been neutered or is exempt from 
neutering 

Section 1: Dog Owner to Complete 

Use BLOCK CAPITALS. All fields are mandatory unless stated otherwise. 

Details of Dog 

Dog’s name 

Microchip number 

Colour of dog 

Date of birth of dog (estimate the date if it is not known) 

Sex of dog 

Enter male or female. 

Details of Owner 

Name of owner 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [491] 17 

Email address of owner (optional) 

Enter an email address if you have one. 

Address of owner 

Eircode 

Contact telephone number of owner 

Signature of owner 

Date 

Section 2: Veterinary Surgeon Declaration 

The Veterinary Surgeon should complete Section 2 and delete Part A or B as 
appropriate. 

Dog’s Name 

Microchip number 

*Date of neutering 

*Date of confirmation that the dog was previously neutered 

*Delete as appropriate 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 18 [491] 

(A) 

*Veterinary Surgeon Neutering Declaration 

I hereby confirm that the dog identified on this form has been neutered through 
castration in the case of a male dog, or through spaying in the case of a female 
dog. 

I hereby confirm that the microchip number of the dog that has been neutered 
matches the microchip number on this form. 

(B) 

*Veterinary Surgeon Exemption from Neutering Declaration 

I hereby certify that in my opinion the dog identified on this form should not be 
neutered for the following Medical Reason(s): 

_______________________________________________________________ 

_______________________________________________________________ 

_______________________________________________________________ 

Examples of Medical Reasons where surgical neutering may be contraindicated:
